model package

base.py

This is the module that defines the base model.

check_params(classes)[source]

Checks the BaseModel parameters.

Parameters:

classes (dict[str, Callable]) – class list.

class BaseModel(classes)[source]

Bases: LightningModule

Defines the base model.

  • You can customize training_step() and validation_step() using .fit.

Parameters:

classes (dict[str, Callable]) – class list.

update_metrics(train, data)[source]

Updates metrics.

Parameters:

  • train (bool) – train flag (training step: True, validation step: False).

  • data (tuple[to.Tensor]) – tuple of labels, preds, and losses.

Returns:

dict[str, float] – all metrics results.

configure_optimizers()[source]

Returns the optimizer method class.

This function is decorated by @override.

Returns:

Callable – optimizer method class.

training_step(batch, batch_idx)[source]

Trains the model one step at a time.

This function is decorated by @override.

  1. Output predictions. (forward propagation)

  2. Output losses.

  3. Update metrics.

  4. Output log.

Parameters:

  • batch (tuple[to.Tensor]) – tuple of inputs and labels.

  • batch_idx (int) – batch index.

Returns:

to.Tensor – loss between the label and the model prediction.

validation_step(batch, batch_idx)[source]

Validations the model one step at a time.

This function is decorated by @override.

  1. Output predictions. (forward propagation)

  2. Output losses.

  3. Update metrics.

  4. Output log.

Parameters:

  • batch (tuple[to.Tensor]) – tuple of inputs and labels.

  • batch_idx (int) – batch index.

Returns:

to.Tensor – loss between the label and the model prediction.

layer.py

This is the module that sets up model layers.

check_params(params, func)[source]

Checks the SetupLayer parameters.

Parameters:

  • params (dict[str, Any]) – parameters.

  • func (dict[str, Callable]) – Class variables whose values are available methods.

class SetupLayer(params)[source]

Bases: object

Sets up the model layer.

  • If you want to use some other settings, implement it as a method of this class. If you implemented, set the name as the func key in __init__ and the method as the value.

Parameters:

params (dict[str, Any]) – parameters.

setup()[source]

Sets up model layers.

Returns:

list[Callable] – list of model layers.

flatten()[source]

Sets to.nn.Flatten.

Returns:

Callable – model layer class.

linear()[source]

Sets to.nn.Linear.

Returns:

Callable – model layer class.

conv2d()[source]

Sets to.nn.Conv2d.

Returns:

Callable – model layer class.

maxpool2d()[source]

Sets to.nn.MaxPool2d.

Returns:

Callable – model layer class.

relu()[source]

Sets to.nn.ReLU.

Returns:

Callable – model layer class.

Sets up model.

  • If you want to use some other settings, implement it as a method of this class. If you implemented, set the name as the func key in __init__ and the method as the value.

Parameters:

params (dict[str, Any]) – parameters.

class SimpleModel(params)[source]

Bases: Module

Builds the following simple model.

  • MLP (Multi Layer Perceptron)

  • CNN (Convolutional Neural Network)

Parameters:

params (dict[str, Any]) – parameters.

Outputs the model predictions.

This function is decorated by @override.

to.Tensor – output.
